title: Massive blaze at Karachi mall: Firefighter among six killed, many feared trapped - video
content: A massive fire ripped through Karachi's Gul Plaza shopping mall late Saturday, killing at least six people, including a firefighter. Rescue operations continued into Sunday as many were feared trapped inside the complex, which suffered severe structural damage. The blaze, suspected to be caused by a short circuit, has reignited concerns over fire safety standards in the city.

title: EU to fire trade 'bazooka'? Macron urges tough action against Trump tariffs
content: France will ask the EU to activate its anti-coercion instrument against potential US tariffs over Greenland. President Macron stated the threat is unacceptable and Europe will not be intimidated. The tool, a trade 'bazooka,' allows the bloc to curb imports or market access in response to economic coercion.

title: 'Bengal ready to topple TMC's maha jungle raj': PM Modi rips into Mamata govt; watch
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, addressing a rally in Singur, West Bengal, urged voters to end the 15-year "mega-jungleraj" of the Mamata Banerjee government. He launched development projects worth over Rs 830 crore and flagged off three Amrit Bharat trains. Modi accused the state government of obstructing central schemes and highlighted West Bengal's potential for development.

title: 'Beautiful woman distracts ... ': Congress MLA ‘rape’ theory remark sparks row
content: Congress MLA Phool Singh Baraiya sparked outrage with remarks suggesting rape can follow seeing a beautiful woman and that SC/ST/OBC women are raped due to scriptural interpretations. Madhya Pradesh CM Mohan Yadav demanded an apology from Rahul Gandhi, while the Congress distanced itself, calling Baraiya's views personal.

title: Lens on Bezos’ ex-wife over donations; millions may have gone to groups under FBI probe
content: MacKenzie Scott's ex-wife, Jeff Bezos, has donated millions to the Solidaire Network, which funds groups facing FBI and congressional investigations for alleged Hamas ties. While Scott's donations are unrestricted, the network supports organizations like Students for Justice in Palestine. Scott has given billions to various causes, impacting diversity programs and higher education.

title: ‘Cautious approach’: After marker row, SEC to revert to bottled indelible ink
content: Following controversy over erasable marker pens in recent municipal polls, the State Election Commission will revert to traditional bottled indelible ink for upcoming local body elections. This cautious approach aims to prevent bogus voting after viral videos showed ink marks being easily removed, sparking widespread criticism and demands for action.

title: IND vs NZ: Kiwi batter Daryl Mitchell equals Babar; closes in on Kohli's record
content: Daryl Mitchell reached another milestone during the third ODI against India, equalling Babar Azam and Pathum Nissanka for the most 50-plus ODI scores since 2023, with only Virat Kohli ahead. Walking in at 5 for 2, Mitchell played a calm 45 off 50 balls, rebuilding New Zealand’s innings after early losses and guiding them past 90 with controlled batting.

title: Who is Nickolay Mladenov? Man at center of Gaza 'board of peace'
content: Nickolay Mladenov, a Bulgarian diplomat and former UN envoy, has been named High Representative for Gaza. He will work to turn a fragile US-backed ceasefire into lasting peace, linking the US, Israel, and Palestinian authorities.

title: Goldman Sachs AI job impact: Analysts see 6-7% jobs displaced; new roles expected
content: Goldman Sachs analysts foresee AI automating a quarter of work hours, potentially displacing 6-7% of jobs. While this signals significant labor shifts, a complete employment crisis is unlikely. Historically, technological advancements have spurred new occupations, suggesting AI will also create unforeseen roles, similar to how frozen foods reshaped the workforce.

title: MP: Speeding car mows down labourers; 2 killed, 11 hurt in Jabalpur
content: A speeding, unplated car mowed down labourers during their lunch break, killing two and injuring eleven in Jabalpur on Sunaday. The victims, from Mandla district, were installing road dividers when the horrific incident occurred near Ekta Chowk. Authorities are actively searching for the driver who fled the scene, with one injured person in critical condition.

title: 'Why are Americans paying?' Trump aide Navarro targets India again; AI in crosshair
content: Donald Trump's trade adviser Peter Navarro has criticized India, questioning why Americans pay for AI services hosted in the US but used by Indian users. This comes amid ongoing trade tensions, including US tariffs on Indian imports and Navarro's past criticisms of India's Russian oil purchases and trade practices.

title: Daryl Mitchell scripts history; makes this record
content: Daryl Mitchell proved a challenge for India in ODIs. His century helped New Zealand post 338. Mitchell's record against India is impressive. He leads in average runs against them. New Zealand's innings saw Mitchell and Glenn Phillips score centuries. This partnership was crucial. India's bowlers took wickets late in the innings. New Zealand finished at 337 for 8.

title: Budget 2026: MAIT seeks customs duty cuts on key electronic components
content: The IT industry body MAIT has urged the government to slash basic customs duty on key electronic components and boost tax incentives in the upcoming Union Budget. This move aims to strengthen domestic manufacturing, improve global competitiveness, and address supply chain vulnerabilities amid rising global uncertainties. MAIT also called for continued support for mobile manufacturing.

title: Amrit Bharat Express expands: PM Modi flags off 3 trains in Assam, Bengal; 2 more lined up
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will be inaugrating five new Amrit Bharat Express trains, expanding India's long-distance rail network. These new services aim to enhance travel experience and connectivity for the common man, with key routes connecting various regions including the North-East, North India, and South India.

title: Riding cycles of over Rs 10 lakh, India braces for historic chapter with Pune Grand Tour 2026
content: India enters a new era in professional cycling with the inaugural Pune Grand Tour, the country’s first UCI 2.2 multi-stage road race. Featuring 171 riders from 35 countries, it is scheduled from January 19 to 23. The five-day event puts India on the global professional cycling map.

title: ‘He was screaming for help’: Techie drowns as car falls into pit in Noida; here’s what happened
content: In a heartbreaking incident, a software developer lost his life when his SUV plunged into a flooded construction pit in Noida. After crashing through a compromised wall, he desperately attempted to remain on the vehicle's roof, calling for help. However, thick fog obscured visibility, and the delayed response of rescue teams resulted in tragic consequences.

title: Smith reveals truth behind Babar Azam 'tantrum' claims as BBL drama erupts
content: Steve Smith has dismissed reports of a rift with teammate Babar Azam, clarifying a on-field decision during their Big Bash League match. Smith explained his tactical choice to prioritize a strong Power Surge over a single, which led to his explosive century.  The pair were later seen chatting casually, with Smith confirming their good relationship.

title: Govinda finally addresses speculation about his marriage to Sunita Ahuja
content: Govinda breaks silence on marriage split rumours with Sunita Ahuja, alleging a "big conspiracy" manipulates family. He calls silence "weakness," prays for no misunderstandings, and notes career struggles since 1987 marriage. Kids Tina (2015 debut) and Yashvardhan prep for films.

title: Hotel politics returns to Mumbai: Mahayuti’s musical chairs over mayor after BMC win
content: The BJP, which emerged as the single largest party with 89 seats in the 227-member House, still falls short of electing a mayor on its own and depends on the Shinde-led Shiv Sena to cross the halfway mark of 114. Together, the allies command 118 seats, but the question of who controls the mayor’s chair, and for how long, remains unresolved.

title: One bar of signal, miles from home: Indian students stranded in Iran; curfew hinders communication
content: Indian students in Iran, particularly near the Iraq border, struggled with internet shutdowns and curfews, relying on sporadic signals to contact anxious families. While some returned due to uncertainty, others remain, reporting campus safety despite the unrest. The situation highlights communication challenges and parental concerns

title: What's wrong with Labubu? Workers at Chinese factory exploited; long work & low pay
content: A report by China Labor Watch revealed exploitative practices at a factory producing popular Labubus dolls for Pop Mart. The factory allegedly hired underage workers without proper protections and forced employees to sign blank contracts. Workers also faced unrealistic production targets and excessive overtime, exceeding legal limits significantly.

title: Budget 2026 outlook: ICRA flags focus on debt consolidation; capex push to continue
content: Ahead of the 2026-27 Union Budget, ICRA anticipates a dual focus on medium-term debt reduction and robust capital expenditure. The budget, aligning with the 16th Finance Commission, aims for a fiscal deficit of 4.3% of GDP. Significant infrastructure spending is expected, with capital expenditure projected to rise by 14% to Rs 13.1 trillion, before potential fiscal pressures emerge.

title: Top US investor warns Google and Microsoft; says trillions are being wasted on AI
content: Renowned investor Michael Burry, famous for predicting the 2008 crash, warns of an AI bubble. He believes tech giants are investing trillions in infrastructure and tools that may not yield lasting returns, likening it to a costly, unnecessary upgrade. Burry cautions that the real economy's utilization is unclear, potentially leading to stagnant tech employment and a long downturn.

title: Biz sentiment: CII-BCI rises for 3rd straight quarter to 66.5; firms upbeat on outlook
content: Indian businesses are feeling more optimistic, with the CII Business Confidence Index hitting a five-quarter high. Strong domestic demand, boosted by GST cuts and festive spending, is driving this positive outlook. Firms anticipate further demand growth and robust investment and hiring intentions, signaling continued economic momentum.

title: Haryana ends age relaxation; makes 6 years mandatory for Class 1 from 2026–27 session
content: Haryana has ended age relaxation for Class 1 admissions, making completion of six years mandatory from the 2026–27 academic session in line with the National Education Policy 2020 and Punjab and Haryana high court directions. The move follows amendments to the Haryana Right to Education Rules, 2011. Children below the cut-off will be placed in Balvatika or pre-primary classes, while private schools in Gurgaon outline limited seat availability and structured admission processes.

title: Iran protests: At least 5,000 killed; Trump, Khamenei draw swords - top developments
content: Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei has acknowledged thousands of deaths during recent nationwide protests, a rare admission amid a harsh crackdown. Khamenei blamed the United States and foreign actors for orchestrating the unrest, which began over economic issues but evolved into anti-regime demonstrations. US President Donald Trump condemned the violence and called for new leadership in Iran.

title: IND vs NZ: Jadeja turns flying eagle to dismiss Young — Watch
content: Ravindra Jadeja produced a sensational flying catch at backward point to dismiss Will Young in the third ODI, swinging momentum India’s way. Diving sharply to his right off Harshit Rana’s bowling, Jadeja ended a key partnership and stunned fans. The moment went viral, highlighting Jadeja’s elite fielding and game-changing impact.

title: Greenland row: Trump rattles EU with tariff threats — why India should take note for US trade deal
content: Trump’s move to impose tariffs on European allies over Greenland underscores how trade measures can be wielded as political tools, regardless of partnerships or agreements. For India, the message is clear: trade deals cannot substitute for strategic autonomy, which must remain non-negotiable.

title: Now, Trump tariffs Europe over Greenland: And the winner is China—explained
content: Trump's threat to impose tariffs on European allies over Greenland has reignited debate on his tariff strategy.  These tariffs are increasingly seen as harming US jobs, keeping inflation high, straining alliances, and failing to curb China's exports, despite revenue gains.

title: ‘Bomb on board’: IndiGo flight makes emergency landing; message written on toilet paper triggers alert
content: A Delhi to Bagdogra flight made an emergency landing in Lucknow on Sunday. This happened after a bomb threat was reported. A message claiming a bomb was on board was found in the aircraft's toilet. The flight carried 238 passengers and crew. Security agencies are conducting a thorough search of the aircraft in Lucknow.

title: Ball girl collapses; match stopped at Australian Open — Watch
content: A ball girl's collapse due to heat briefly halted an Australian Open match, with players Zeynep Sonmez and Ekaterina Alexandrova offering immediate assistance. Despite the interruption and rising temperatures, Sonmez secured a significant career victory. This incident highlights the challenges of extreme weather at the tournament, with further heat expected.

title: Market recap: Mcap of 3 of top-10 most valued firms jumps by Rs 75,855 cr
content: Despite a flat broader market, State Bank of India and Infosys propelled a Rs 75,855 crore gain in the market capitalisation of three top Indian firms. While Reliance Industries and Larsen & Toubro saw significant drops, Infosys's boosted guidance offered a positive outlook for IT stocks. The top ten companies' rankings remained unchanged.

title: Lloyd calls Tendulkar live after Waugh leaves him out of all-time XI — Watch
content: A humorous podcast moment saw Sachin Tendulkar unexpectedly left out of an all-time XI by Mark Waugh. A live call to Tendulkar, introduced as 'Bumble' by David Lloyd, was abruptly cut off, eliciting laughter. The article highlights Tendulkar's unparalleled record, with Virat Kohli the closest active challenger, still significantly behind in runs and centuries.

title: Chiefs heiress Gracie Hunt's heartfelt life update amid team's tough season
content: The Kansas City Chiefs had a pretty disappointing season this time, but the billionaire heiress, Gracie Hunt, has always been there for the team. Amid all the mess, Gracie Hunt has made a wholesome post about her life along with a few inspirational words that has moved fans. With the team's poor performance, many of their players are also getting trolled brutally.

title: Steelers nation demands change after Tomlin's steelers exit
content: Steelers Nation has accepted Mike Tomlin's departure after nearly two decades, with a poll showing 64.79% of fans believing it was the right decision. While acknowledging his past success and Super Bowl title, fans expressed frustration with recent playoff disappointments and conservative play-calling. Tomlin is reportedly considering a move to television.

title: Stephen Curry pens 'keep shooting' for Klay Thompson's 3-point mark
content: Klay Thompson has officially become the NBA's fourth all-time leader in three-pointers, surpassing Damian Lillard with 2,805 made.  This remarkable achievement, despite past injuries, drew praise from former teammate Stephen Curry.  The duo, once a legendary backcourt, continues to share mutual respect and support even after Thompson's move to Dallas.

title: When menopause hits: How symptoms spill into work, home and relationships
content: Societal conditioning often diminishes women's worth as they age, clashing with the biological realities of perimenopause and menopause. This transition brings profound physical, cognitive, and emotional shifts, yet women are frequently dismissed and unprepared for these changes. Understanding and addressing these symptoms with medical and lifestyle support is crucial for navigating this life stage with dignity and reclaiming autonomy.

title: Majority of incumbent MLAs in Kozhikode may get another chance
content: There are 13 Assembly constituencies in the district and the Left Democratic Front has 11 representatives. The others belong to the Indian Union Muslim League and the Revolutionary Marxist Party

title: Poor adherence to pet ownership norms raises public safety concerns
content: Animal welfare activists and rescuers say weak implementation and unchecked pet abandonment continue to worsen public safety and animal health concerns in both urban and rural areas

title: BJP is people’s first choice, Congress has lost the nation’s trust: PM
content: PM cites poll results for Bihar Assembly, Mumbai local body, and Thiruvananthapuram mayor to claim a national trend; accuses Congress of handing over Assam land to infiltrators, neglecting Kaziranga National Park

title: One more tiger cub captured in Nanjidevanapura in Chamarajanagar
content: With the tigress and two cubs already captured, the operation to capture the remaining two tiger cubs is under way

title: Jagan’s faction politics haunting Palnadu, alleges Energy Minister
content: Gottipati Ravi Kumar claims that during its five-year rule, the YSRCP completely devastated the Palnadu region, and now, as the State moves forward on the path of development, they are unable to tolerate the progress

title: 1 dead, 24 injured in vehicle pile-up in Uttar Pradesh amid dense fog
content: A state roadways bus travelling from Gorakhpur to Meerut hit a truck, following which several vehicles coming from behind crashed into one another due to poor visibility, said SHO of Faridpur Police station Radheshyam

title: PM accuses TMC of endangering national security, calls for ending ‘maha jungle raj’ in Bengal
content: With the State Assembly polls a few months away, Mr. Modi framed the electoral contest as one between “maha- jungle raj and good governance" and urged voters to back the BJP’s “double-engine government” model

title: Two more Maoists killed on second day of operation in Bijapur; toll rises to six: Police
content: The latest exchange of fire occurred in the morning in the forested hills of Bijapur’s northwestern region, where a joint team of security forces has been conducting an anti-Maoist operation, police said

title: Patent for nutraceutical to manage gut health developed by Kerala University researchers
content: The development of the nutraceutical, PolyNutriBio (PNBio), was a three-year research project taken up by A. Helen, former Head of the Biochemistry department and Maya G. Pillai, Scientist, who has done extensive research on inflammation.

title: India will remain ‘Vishwaguru’ as long as guided by dharma: Bhagwat
content: Mohan Bhagwat said as long as such dharma drives Bharat, it will remain ‘Vishwaguru’, adding the world does not possess this kind of knowledge because it lacks spirituality

title: Trinamool MP Yusuf Pathan visits house of Bengal migrant worker killed in Jharkhand
content: The visit by the cricketer turned politician to the house of a deceased migrant worker hailing from his constituency comes at instructions of party general secretary Abhishek Banerjee.

title: 55,000 students to be imparted quantum skilling course in A.P.
content: It is a declaration that the State is ready to shape the next technological revolution, says APSCHE Chairman

title: "Your Future Will Be Over": Kapil Sibal's Warning To BJP Allies
content: Rajya Sabha MP Kapil Sibal on Sunday launched a sharp attack on BJP, cautioning opposition parties against entering alliances with it, warning that such compromises may offer short-term power but lead to long-term politicsl marginalisation.

title: 'Rs 3,000 Per Plot, Papers Taken': Manipur's Displaced Tribals Seek Answers From Civil Group ITLF
content: Members of tribal communities who left Manipur's capital Imphal after Meitei-Kuki ethnic violence broke out in May 2023 have asked a civil society organisation of the Kuki tribes to give details of money and documents it has taken from them.

title: Woman, 22, Dies By Suicide After Husband Says No To Buying Phone: Cops
content: A heartbreaking incident has come to light from the Aravalli district of Gujarat, where a impulse decision broke a family. A 22-year-old migrant woman allegedly took her own life following a dispute with her husband over a mobile phone.

title: Woman Cop Honoured With Railways' Top Award For Rescuing Over 150 Children
content: Railway Protection Force (RPF) Inspector Chandana Sinha has been conferred the Ati Vishisht Rail Seva Puraskar, the highest service honour of Indian Railways, by the Ministry of Railways for rescuing over 150 children in 2024.

title: UP Man Attacks Sisters With Knife For Resisting Harassment
content: A man allegedly attacked with a knife two sisters he was harassing near the Daulatpur Ghat area here when one of them protested against him, police said on Sunday.

title: TVK Chief Vijay To Appear Before CBI In Delhi Over Karur Stampede Case
content: TVK chief Vijay left for Delhi on Sunday to appear before the CBI on January 19 in connection with the Karur stampede case.

title: Techie Drowns In Noida Ditch, Told Father "Don't Want To Die" In Last Call
content: The incident took place on Friday night near Sector 150, when the techie, Yuvraj Mehta, was returning home from work.

title: 1 Dead, 24 Injured In Vehicle Collisions Due To Fog On Delhi-Lucknow Highway
content: A pile-up involving at least 20 vehicles on the Delhi-Lucknow National Highway in Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly district amid dense fog on Sunday morning left a person dead, and at least 24 injured.

title: Assam Won't Bow Before Pak Agent: Himanta Sarma's Veiled Dig at Gaurav Gogoi
content: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said on Sunday that no resident of the state would bow before a Pakistani agent. He made the remark during the foundation-laying ceremony of the Kaziranga Elevated Corridor Project.

title: "Testimony Will Blow Your Mind": Elon Musk "Can't Wait" For OpenAI Trial
content: Billionaire Elon Musk "can't wait" for the high-stakes jury trial against OpenAI and its key partner Microsoft, saying the upcoming court proceedings will reveal explosive details.

title: AAP's Sanjay Singh Among 8 Charged For Spreading 'Fake' Images Of Manikarnika Ghat
content: Police here have registered eight FIRs against people including AAP MP Sanjay Singh, independent MP Pappu Yadav, for allegedly circulating AI-generated content and misleading information on social media about redevelopment work at Manikarnika Ghat.

title: DK Shivakumar Cancels Davos Trip, Cites Congress Meeting On Assam Polls
content: Karnataka Deputy Chief Minister D K Shivakumar has cancelled his scheduled visit to the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, citing official engagements in New Delhi and Bengaluru.

title: "I Tried Everything": Noida Techie's Father Recounts "Papa, Save Me" Call
content: A 27-year-old software engineer, Yuvraj Mehta, died after his car plunged into a deep, water-filled ditch amid dense fog in Noida, a tragedy his father, Rajkumar Mehta, says unfolded as he heard his son's desperate pleas of "papa mujhe bacha lo."

title: PM Lays Foundation Stone Of Kaziranga Elevated Corridor Project In Assam
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday laid the foundation stone of the Kaziranga Elevated Corridor Project, covering the 4-laning of the Kaliabor-Numaligarh section of National Highway 715, in Kaliabor, Nagaon district.

title: Vijay Summoned By CBI Again In Karur Case, He Will Be In Delhi Tomorrow
content: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) has issued a fresh summons to Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam (TVK) leader Vijay, directing him to appear once again in New Delhi on Monday in connection with the probe into the Karur stampede.

title: Protests In Bengal Over Migrant Worker's Death In Jharkhand, Yusuf Pathan Meets Family
content: TMC MP from Murshidabad Yusuf Pathan visited the residence of a migrant labourer from Beldanga whose unnatural death in Jharkhand earlier this week triggyered mob violence in the West Bengal town and pledged his support to the victim's family.

title: How Russia Is Weaponising Winter Against Ukraine
content: For many Kyiv residents, electricity is available for only a few hours daily, and apartments have gone without heat for days.

title: 12 Detained In UP For Offering Namaz In Empty House 'Without Permission'
content: Police have detained 12 people in a village in Bareilly district for allegedly offering namaz at a empty house "without permission", officials said on Sunday.

title: US Needs Greenland, Claims Trump. 75% Americans Disagree: Report
content: The survey found that 52 per cent of respondents strongly oppose any US attempt to seize the semi-autonomous Danish territory, while only one in four Americans support the proposal.

title: Terrorists engaged in firing, additional troops rushed to Kishtwar’s Chhatru: Army
content: “A contact was established with terrorists in Son Nar, northeast of Chhatru, during a deliberate search operation conducted as part of ongoing joint counter-terror operations along with the J&K Police,” Army said

title: Chitradurga tops State in Ganitha Ganaka initiative
content: The district is a top performer in the implementation of the evidence-backed programme launched by the State government

title: How long will Modi government live in denial, asks Congress citing World Bank's air pollution report
content: Jairam Ramesh said the Congress has suggested a vast expansion of the National Clean Air Programme (NCAP), both in terms of financial outlays and geographic coverage, with measurement of PM 2.5 levels as the yardstick for performance

title: Technology-driven policing helps Bengaluru Police reunite missing children with families in record time
content: The first incident occurred on December 27, 2025, under the jurisdiction of J.P. Nagar Police Station, when a mentally unstable woman attempted to take away a two-year-old child

title: Kerala SIR: EC should ensure that all eligible citizens find a place in electoral roll, says Sathyan Mokeri
content: CPI leader expresses deep concern over the fact that lakhs of people were excluded from the voters’ list in Kerala as part of the SIR

title: Parappana Agrahara police book two convicts for assault on assistant jailer
content: Police registered an FIR after the Prison Department conducted an internal inquiry and subsequently lodged a formal complaint

title: SEC annuls vice-president’s election in Kottangal grama panchayat in Pathanamthitta
content: Decision followed a complaint filed by the SDPI, which alleged that the election held to the post of vice-president was conducted in violation of statutory norms

title: Amid criticism by Vellappally Natesan and Sukumaran Nair, Kerala Opposition leader V.D. Satheesan says he is against bid to cause communal rift, not leaders
content: I am  not above criticism. Anyone can criticise me. I will correct myself if there is merit in the criticism, says Satheesan

title: Bids invited for construction of International Bird Centre in Villupuram
content: To be built at an estimated cost of ₹46.94 crore, the centre is envisaged as a hub for bird conservation awareness through both interior (displays and models) and exterior (wetland mimic area/nature trail) interpretations.

title: Old generation should step aside when things start running smoothly: Gadkari
content: Mr. Gadkari also emphasised the importance of the industrial sector, agriculture and allied sectors and the service sector for the development of any region

title: Two dead in multi-vehicle pileup amid dense fog in Nuh
content: People present at the spot said that the accident occurred when a truck carrying crushers suddenly applied brakes, and four other vehicles crashed into it due to dense fog

title: Microscopic crustacean discovered in Kavaratti established as a new genus and species, say researchers
content: Crustacean has been named Indiaphonte bijoyi, with the generic name Indiaphonte honouring India and the species name bijoyi named after S. Bijoy Nandan, Dean, Faculty of Marine Sciences, Cusat

title: ‘You can’t malign me with motivated reports,’ Telangana Deputy CM Bhatti Vikramarka says
content: I earned my position with self-respect and will not compromise on Telangana’s resources, the deputy CM said

title: Wings India 2026 in Hyderabad from January 28-31; over 20 countries’ delegations to attend
content: The conference will comprise 13 thematic sessions in addition to a Global CEOs Forum and a Ministerial Plenary

title: Government land scam in Nagamangala: Upalokayukta registers suo motu case against tahsildar, others
content: A criminal case has also been registered against 11 persons involved in the alleged scam after a search by officials showed large-scale manipulation of government land records to facilitate the illegal grant of public land

title: Unity of Nairs and Ezhavas essential: Vellappally Natesan
content: Natesan clarified that he had never opposed Muslims, but was critical only of the communal tendencies within the Indian Union Muslim League (IUML)

title: PM Modi unveils development projects worth over ₹830 crore, flags off three Amrit Bharat trains in Bengal
content: The PM also inaugurated the Jayrambati-Barogopinathpur-Maynapur rail line, and flagged off a train between Maynapur and Jayrambati

title: Sree Narayana Guru’s impact on Dalits in Kerala deeper than Ambedkar’s in north, says Shashi Tharoor
content: Swami Vivekananda once called Kerala a lunatic asylum, Shashi Tharoor explains how Narayana Guru changed it

title: Revanth Reddy inaugurates development works, virtually sounds municipal poll bugle in Khammam district
content: Revanth Reddy has called upon nursing students to learn foreign languages such as Japanese and German to explore enormous job opportunities abroad

title: Government seeking dates as no merit in NSA case against Sonam Wangchuk, says Gitanjali Angmo
content: Gitanjali Angmo alleged that Mr. Wangchuk should already be out of prison considering “procedural lapses” by authorities, saying it is an “open and shut case”

title: 12 detained for offering namaz in empty house 'without permission' in UP
content: “A video purportedly showing people offering prayers inside the house has surfaced and is being circulated on social media,” says the police

title: TMC MP Yusuf Pathan visits residence of deceased migrant labourer in Bengal's Beldanga
content: Pathan said the District Administration set up helpline numbers for migrant workers working outside Bengal and called upon them to contact the administration if they faced any trouble

title: Mustabu programme extended to villages successfully in Parvatipuram-Manyam district: District Collector
content: Collector that the students who are supposed to concentrate on personal hygiene and appearance under the Mustabu programme were successfully launched in many villages, including Biyyalavalasa of Kurupam mandal of the district

title: Police in southern districts of Tamil Nadu execute over 1,100 long-pending non-bailable warrants during Pongal
content: “It helped to avert untoward incidents during the festival season,” says Inspector General of Police (South Zone) Vijayendra Bidari

title: Man dies after car plunges into water-filled pit in Greater Noida; initial probe flags ‘fog, overspeeding’
content: The deceased was identified as a 27-year-old software engineer with a company in Gurugram; local residents staged a protest alleging negligence

title: Bomb threat in Delhi-Bagdogra IndiGo flight forces emergency landing in Lucknow
content: During preliminary checks, a handwritten note on a tissue paper bearing the words "Plane mein bomb" (bomb in the plane) was found, police said

title: Amravati civic polls: 22 BJP candidates claim Navneet Rana campaigned against party
content: They claimed that former Amravati Lok Sabha MP Navneet Rana aggressively dubbed the saffron party nominees as "dummies" and promoted contestants of her husband Ravi Rana's Yuva Swabhiman Party as the "real BJP candidates"

title: Bus collides with car amid thick fog in U.P., two dead
content: “The accident occurred near Babu Ganj on the Raebareli-Sultanpur highway. The collision took place due to poor visibility caused by thick fog,” says police

title: BJP’s responsibility to ensure Mumbai’s progress: Omar Abdullah
content: The election took place after a long gap. In every election, somebody wins, and somebody lags behind. The BJP secured the maximum number of seats. It becomes their responsibility to ensure progress of Mumbai, says CM Omar Abdullah

title: Former CPI(M) MLA S. Rajendran joins BJP
content: Rajendran had represented the Devikulam constituency in Idukki district as s CPI(M) member in 2006, 2011 and 2016

title: Centre urged to honour N.T. Rama Rao with Bharata Ratna award
content: NTR, as he was popularly known, had brought changes in the administrative setup with the formation of mandals as part of taking services closer to the people

title: Remarks against Col. Sofiya Qureshi: SC to hear plea of MP Minister Vijay Shah
content: On July 28, 2025, the top court had pulled up Vijay Shah for not placing a public apology over his remarks on record against Col Qureshi, saying he was "testing the court's patience"

title: CM tells officials to focus on completion of irrigation projects
content: Due priority must be accorded to widening of the Handri-Neeva canals and Veligonda, Uttarandhra, and Nallamala Sagar projects, he advised

title: Need to erase caste from mind to end discrimination: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat
content: Responding to questions from the audience, Mr. Bhagwat said the Sangh aims to lead India to its ultimate glory along with society

title: Nearly 3.15 crore devotees take holy dip on Mauni Amavasya at Sangam in Uttar Pradesh
content: Earlier, about 1.03 crore devotees had taken a dip on the occasion of Makar Sankranti, while nearly 85 lakh people bathed in the Ganga and Sangam on Ekadashi

title: WEF 2026: India readies power-packed presence before global elite
content: From India, at least four Union Ministers— Ashwini Vaishnaw, Shivraj Singh Chouhan, Pralhad Joshi, and K Rammohan Naidu — as well as six Chief Ministers are expected to be there, along with over 100 top CEOs from the country

title: Former Maharashtra BJP Minister Raj Purohit passes away at 71
content: A well-known figure in Mumbai BJP circles, he had served as the party's city president and a Minister in the Maharashtra government, and was the BJP's chief whip in the Assembly between 2014 and 2019

title: PM Modi lays foundation stone for ₹6,957-crore Kaziranga corridor, flags off two Amrit Bharat trains
content: The Kaziranga project has been designed in compliance with the directions of the Supreme Court and the recommendations of the Wildlife Institute of India

title: GBS outbreak claims two lives in MP; govt. ramps up detection, treatment
content: Following the detection of over a dozen cases in Manasa town, the authorities have been instructed to establish a control room there, create a special ward for GBS patients at the local government hospital, and make other necessary arrangements to tackle the outbreak

title: Samajwadi Party to move Supreme Court on electoral transparency: Akhilesh
content: We are planning to move the Supreme Court to verify whether the voter list prepared by the Election Commission is valid or the list compiled by the State Election Commission is accurate, says Akhilesh Yadav

title: Maharashtra CM Fadnavis, U.S. Envoy Gor discuss boosting investments and business ties
content: The two sides explored opportunities to enhance U.S. investments in Maharashtra and support State-based companies looking to expand their presence in the U.S., he said

title: In Frames: Prayerful in Prayagraj
content: Ceremonies for the Magh Mela, which began on January 3, have been drawing crores of devotees to the Triveni Sangam for a holy dip; a footfall of 15-20 crore is expected by the culmination of the festival on Mahasivaratri; pilgrims offer prayers amid tight security arrangements and bustling crowds

title: Two militants arrested in Manipur's Bishnupur
content: At Chairel Ahallup in the district, a member of the outlawed PREPAK (Pro) was arrested on Saturday, a police officer said

title: Sanjay Singh, Pappu Yadav among 8 booked for spreading ‘fake’ images of Manikarnika ghat
content: According to the police, fabricated images and misleading content, contrary to the actual facts related to the ongoing beautification work at Manikarnika Ghat, were shared on social media platform X

title: Dense fog shrouds Delhi, air quality severe
content: The India Meteorological Department has also placed the city under a yellow alert, warning of dense fog at many isolated places till forenoon

title: In Haryana, the birth of a son
content: Haryana’s Dhani Bhojraj village witnessed exuberant festivities when a 37-year-old woman gave birth to a boy after 18 years and 10 daughters. Ashna Butani visits the village and finds out how the family’s ‘wish for a son’ is rooted in persistent social taunts and an enduring cultural longing for a male child even as the State’s sex ratio steadily improves

title: Has an Arbitration Council been constituted? | Explained
content: What would be the functions of the Arbitration Council of India? Why have there been concerns with respect to institutional impartiality? What are some of the criticisms of the amendments? What does the draft Arbitration and Conciliation (Amendment) Bill, 2024 propose?

title: Ahmedabad–Gandhinagar Metro ridership rises fourfold in three years
content: More than 11.50 crore passengers travelled on the Ahmedabad–Gandhinagar Metro between October 2022 and December 2025

title: AMMK’s decision on alliance to be revealed by leader of senior partner, says Dhinakaran
content: The AMMK leader reiterates that no party will secure an absolute majority of its own in the upcoming Assembly election and there will be a coalition government in the State

title: Denver advances, but Bo Nix is out: Six questions about where the Broncos go from here
content: The Broncos advanced to the AFC title game but lost their QB to a broken ankle. So what's next for them on their Super Bowl quest?

title: Broncos' Nix breaks bone in ankle, out for playoffs
content: Broncos quarterback Bo Nix will miss the remainder of the playoffs after breaking a bone in his right ankle during overtime of Saturday's 33-30 win over the Bills, coach Sean Payton said.

title: Sources: Steelers open to Rodgers' return in '26
content: The Steelers remain open to an Aaron Rodgers reunion in 2026, even though it's unlikely because of Mike Tomlin's resignation, sources told ESPN.

title: Seahawks showcase full arsenal, blow out 49ers
content: The Seahawks delivered an all-three-phases beatdown of the 49ers on Saturday, racing to a 17-0 lead and never looking back in a 41-6 win to advance to the NFC title game.

title: Falcons hire Stefanski in Ryan's 1st move as prez
content: The Falcons hired Kevin Stefanski on Saturday after the former Browns coach and two-time NFL Coach of the Year had his second interview with the team earlier in the day.

title: Allen devastated, but loss not on QB, Bills say
content: After another playoff loss that ended a promising season for the Bills, quarterback Josh Allen told reporters that "I feel like I let my teammates down tonight," though Buffalo players and coaches disagreed after the Broncos won 33-30 on Saturday night.

title: Bills' McDermott rips refs' ruling on pivotal INT
content: Bills coach Sean McDermott wasn't happy with the way officials handled a critical overtime play that resulted in a Broncos interception Saturday, saying it was "too big of a play" not to stop the game and review it.

title: Venus makes Aussie Open history, falters in loss
content: Venus Williams became the oldest player to compete in singles at the Australian Open, but faltered late in a three-set loss to Olga Danilovic.

title: Spurs outlast Edwards despite 55-point barrage
content: Less than a week after blowing a big early lead in a loss to Minnesota, the Spurs held on for the win Saturday despite a 55-point effort from Anthony Edwards.

title: 👀 Offseason guide for all eliminated NFL teams
content: The NFL offseason has arrived for 26 teams. What must each do to have a better season in 2026? We have outlooks, early buzz and predictions.

title: Key questions about close officiating calls in the Broncos' win over the Bills
content: When is a catch a catch and how much contact draws a penalty flag were in dispute Saturday in Denver.

title: Sizing up overreactions, big questions from the divisional round: Why do the Bills keep falling short?
content: Another Super Bowl-less season for Buffalo? But are the Broncos also done? And did Seattle ace last offseason? Let's make sense of every divisional round game.

title: Guide to two more divisional round games: Previews, bold predictions, more
content: Texans-Patriots? Rams-Bears? We have picks, predictions and stats to know for the divisional round games.

title: Kevin Stefanski to Falcons: Grading the hire and the impact on Penix
content: Kevin Stefanski didn't have a great record in Cleveland, but he'll have more talent to work with in Atlanta.

title: John Harbaugh to the Giants! Eight questions and a grade for New York's move
content: The 63-year-old has been able to call his own shot in this coaching search and wound up choosing the Giants.

title: How the Bears, Caleb Williams became an offensive juggernaut
content: Ben Johnson helped build one of the most explosive offenses in the NFL in Chicago. Here's how he did it.

title: The man, the meme, the legend: Curt Cignetti's rise to viral fame
content: Curt Cignetti has lots to be happy about, but you wouldn't know it by looking at him. His players and assistants break down their favorite Cignetti memes and faces.

title: Meet 'the special 13': The JMU transfers forming an unlikely Indiana CFP title core
content: Thirteen Dukes players followed Curt Cignetti to become Hoosiers. Those who remain are on the verge of CFB history.

title: Men's: Duke is a 1-seed again
content: Is the ACC back? Eight single-digit seeds -- including one on the top line -- and a couple of bubble teams would suggest so.

title: Women's: South Carolina ascends to No. 2 overall
content: Texas, which fell at South Carolina on Thursday, tumbles to the final No. 1 seed after its second straight loss.

title: Man United deliver huge blow to Man City title hopes with shock derby win
content: Manchester City's title bid is as good as over after Manchester United won the midfield battle at Old Trafford.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool eye Inter defender Bastoni
content: Liverpool are looking to bolster their defensive options by signing Inter Milan's Alessandro Bastoni. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Transfer window weekly: Güler to Arsenal? Chelsea squad changes?
content: The winter transfer window is open, so what are our reporters hearing about deals that could be done?

title: How Mike Tomlin spent his final day as the Steelers head coach
content: 'It was dead silent' when the coach stunned the Steelers' locker room. Here's what we know about what's next.

title: Giannis and the Bucks: Four possible pathways forward in Milwaukee at the deadline
content: The Bucks and Antetokounmpo currently sit in 11th place ahead of the trade deadline. What are their options?

title: Will Fernando Mendoza be the next Heisman-winning QB to fall victim to the national championship curse?
content: Since 1988, seven quarterbacks who have won the Heisman Trophy and earned a title game berth have fallen in the national championship game. Is Mendoza next?

title: 'First round's on me': DePaul coach Holtmann covers drinks for students after Marquette win
content: Chris Holtmann seems to have DePaul moving in the right direction. And after record student attendance, the coach gave back in a very collegiate manner: free drinks.

title: Can Miami become the latest team to lift the national title on 'home' field?
content: this year marks the ninth national championship of the BCS and playoff eras . a team playing a national championship game at its home stadium is unprecedented in FBS history . one of the competing squads will be from the same state as the title .

title: VAR review: Should Man United's Dalot have received a red card for foul on Doku?
content: Mikel Arteta questions the decision not to award a late penalty in their goalless draw with Nottingham Forest . the video assistant referee causes controversy every week in the premier league . we take a look at the major incidents to examine and explain the process .

title: Rams-Bears set to join list of coldest playoff games
content: temperatures could drop to single digits for divisional round game between los Angeles Rams and the Chicago Bears . if 2 degrees is where we end up, the Rams-Bears still won't be among the top five coldest playoff games . the 1967 NFL championship reigns supreme as the coldest postseason game .

title: 10 NBA teams that could swing trade season's final 20 days
content: the league's three-week sprint to the Feb. 5 trade deadline is here . many contenders are still deciding on a direction . a weekly trip around the Association focuses on those teams trying to add to their rosters .

title: How will latest moves rock the NL East?
content: the nleast east's offseason activity hasn't happened in new york . the national league east is experiencing a dizzying winter with major upheaval . each team has an urgency rating based on how much each still needs to accomplish .

title: Carson Beck the runner? The Miami QB is finally using his feet
content: Carson Beck hasn't run a 40-yard dash in years, but it hardly qualifies him as slow . he showcased his wheels on a 3-yard scramble into the end zone to secure a trip to the college football playoff national championship . safety Jakobe Thomas appeared to be the originator, dubbing Beck as the Miami's version of Michael Vick .

title: Points league rankings: Young and Davis slide, Sabonis returns
content: the fantasy basketball head-to-head points league player rankings are updated regularly throughout the season based on player performances, injuries, trades, signings and other trends . the team announced this week that Young's knee and quadriceps injuries would keep him out for at least the next month, if not longer . this news dropped Young to the bottom of the top-60 in points league rankings .

title: MLB offseason grades: Mets pivot to Bichette after Dodgers sign top free agent Tucker
content: the 2025-26 offseason is officially here, and we have you covered with grades and analysis for every major signing and trade this winter . the deal: three years, $126 million with opt-outs after first two seasons Grade: B- The new york Mets have a new heart .

title: All-Pro LBs to coaches: How Texans' Ryans, Patriots' Vrabel have revived former teams
content: deMeco Ryans' first season as coach of the Houston Texans was interrupted by a fan in a grocery store . he was drawn back by the success and renewed energy the former linebacker had brought to texans football . the fan said he had started watching football again, but he couldn't stomach the losing .

title: Seahawks start fast and roll past 49ers, advance to NFC Championship Game
content: the Seahawks return the opening kickoff for a touchdown and never look back in a rout of the 49ers in the divisional round . coach Mike Macdonald's team now has an even stronger claim as the most complete team in this season's playoffs . the team's top-rated special teams got it started with Rashid Shaheed returning the kickoff 95 yards .

title: How Davante Adams broke through in L.A. after failing to do so with Raiders, Jets
content: davante Adams signed a two-year, $44 million contract in march . he has a $28 million cap number in 2026 . the Rams head coach's message was clear . it didn't take long for Adams to realize that playing for him was where he needed to be .

title: 'Truth of India': Mufti responds to Rahman's 'communal' remark; shares 'realities of Indian Muslims'
content: NEW DELHI: The former chief minister of Jammu and Kashmir, Mehbooba Mufti, responded to AR Rahman's "communal" remark, stating that it is the "truth of India." Music composer AR Rahman, in a BBC Asian Network interview, had stated that he has been getting less work in the industry, and he feels it is a "communal thing. " In a post on X, Mehbooba Mufti wrote, "Bollywood has always been a living mini India, mirroring the country’s social realities. Brushing aside such experiences does not change the truth about today’s India."
